results.title: Nerida Anderson, 1939
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Three of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. Set in 1939, this episode examines attempts by Nerida Anderson and her family to improve conditions on the Aboriginal Reserve where they live. Such attempts and displays of independence outrage the manager. He has Nerida and her family tried for treason. Realising a no-win situation, the entire population of the reserve pack their belongings and leave.

results.title: Neptune's Daughter
results.brief_description: The daughter of King Neptune takes on human form to avenge the death of her young sister, who was caught in a fishing net. However, she falls in love with the king, the man she holds responsible.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

results.title: Nepal: where the legends live
results.brief_description: Short documentary exploring the elements which draw travellers from all over the glove to Nepal, including culture, spiritual practices, and the natural beauty of the surrounding land. Narrated by Gunter Less.

results.title: Neorealism
results.brief_description: Documentary exploring the Italian film movement, Neo-realism, which developed during World War II and dealt with moral, social and political problems in real locations. Includes interviews with Roberto Rossellini, Vittorio De Sica, Michaelangelo Antonioni, Pier Paolo Pasolini and Bernardo Bertolucci. Features film clips from Rossellini’s “Rome, open city” and “Paisa” and De Sica’s “Umberto D”.

results.title: Neoplastic Astrocytes
results.brief_description: Shows the characteristic features of astrocytes in astrocytomas, glioblastomas and astroblastomas. Coloured Bodian preparations are shown for comparison with the living cells. The form density and activity of neoplastic astrocytes and component elements are revealed. The film concludes with two typical astrocytes.

results.title: Neonatal death
results.creator_credit: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
It is difficult to imagine the full impact of neonatal death on those women who are mothers for the shortest time. This video discusses the effects of the death of a baby on women’s mental and physical health. The grief process is viewed within the context of a wide range of stresses experienced by a woman and her fanily during this major life crisis including the impact of a premature birth: the stresses associated with having a seriously ill baby in neonatal intensive care: the difficulties in decision-making related to medical interventions: the consideration of siblings and their inclusion in the bonding and grief experiences.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
results.creator_credit: Kazuya Tsurumaki, Hideaki Anno, Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, SEGA, Toei Company, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Production I.G, TV Tokyo, Star Child Recording, Movic and GAINAX
results.brief_description: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series about the battle between humanity and terrifying angels.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

results.title_for_label: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kazuya Tsurumaki, Hideaki Anno, Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, SEGA, Toei Company, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Production I.G, TV Tokyo, Star Child Recording, Movic and GAINAX
results.description: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series. Comprising of two alternate episodes which were first intended to take the place of episodes 25 and 26, this finale answers many of the questions surrounding the series, while also opening up some new possibilities.
description_for_label: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series. Comprising of two alternate episodes which were first intended to take the place of episodes 25 and 26, this finale answers many of the questions surrounding the series, while also opening up some new possibilities.
